title: Betteshanger (Fowlmead) Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Nick Smith / Lake at Fowlmead Country Park
images.caption: Lake at Fowlmead Country Park

images.title: Nick Smith / The visitor centre at Fowlmead Country Park

images.title: David Anstiss / Footbridge over Crescent Pond in Fowlmead Country Park
images.caption: Footbridge over Crescent Pond in Fowlmead Country Park. This bridge is over a dried out pond, is on a footpath in the park leading to Lydden Wood (in background) and then back to the car park.

images.title: Two Red Wheelies head along the Fowlmead Cycle Track by David Anstiss, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Two Red Wheelies head along the Fowlmead Cycle Track

images.title: Nick Smith / Looking towards the sea from Fowlmead Country Park
images.caption: Looking towards the sea from the park

images.title: Nick Smith / View across farmland from Fowlmead Country Park
images.caption: View across farmland from the park

description: Betteshanger (previously Fowlmead) country park is a 200 acre site with a number of walking and cycling trails located in Deal on the Kent coast. The park has eleven zoned areas with each one offering something different for visitors to explore, including rolling woodland and small lakes, superb walks and fabulous views over the east Kent coast. For cyclists there is a 2 mile Tarmac road cycling track which can be used by the general public, while there are also mountain bike trails to try out. Cycle hire is available in the park for reasonable rates.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a nice place to bring your dog for a walk. You are advised to keep them on leads.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area you could pick up the Dover to Deal Walk and enjoy a hike along the cliff tops. For more walking ideas in the area see the Kent Walks page.
